originalText.text: Came in late on a Friday afternoon, in a hurry. Nick matched my energy, explained my options, then quickly got me sorted, out the store, and on my way. 10/10!

text.text: Came in late on a Friday afternoon, in a hurry. Nick matched my energy, explained my options, then quickly got me sorted, out the store, and on my way. 10/10!

originalText.text: They have the most knowledgeable kind nice people working at this company owned great T-Mobile store, top knotch

text.text: They have the most knowledgeable kind nice people working at this company owned great T-Mobile store, top knotch

originalText.text: I was assisted very good when purchasing my SIM card for the holidays. This was much cheaper than the other mobile phone shops I visited in New York. Friendly staff as well. The coverage was great as well. Very recommendable.

text.text: I was assisted very good when purchasing my SIM card for the holidays. This was much cheaper than the other mobile phone shops I visited in New York. Friendly staff as well. The coverage was great as well. Very recommendable.

originalText.text: Merrill and his team are very unprofessional and untrained.  will not come back to this location again.

text.text: Merrill and his team are very unprofessional and untrained.  will not come back to this location again.

originalText.text: I was sold a pair of horrible sounding Beats headphones that I took out of the box only once. I returned them tonight and received my refund, only to get a call back from a man who appeared to be the manager. I did not get his name. He proceeded to mention the headphones did not match the serial number on the box and that he would be reversing my refund. I went back into the store (9306) to find what appeared to be the entire staff huddled up over the headphones sold to me. The manager went on about how he would not accept the headphones and would not be refunding me. He explained that the box had been opened outside of the store. I explained that the box was opened by the rep, Anthony, who sold me the headphones. I put them on, on the way to the train and they were horrible. I put them back in the box and never opened the box again. No matter how much I tried to explain that this was the way this item was sold to me, he wouldn't hear it. I let him know I did not appreciate his accusations and I would contact my card company regarding my refund. I called to file a formal complaint. Unfortunately, as of October 1st, T-Mobile corporate headquarters support line to file a formal complaint has been shut down. I did complain through customer service. I will not be sold a horrible item, and to add insult to injury, then be accused of doing something funny with a pair of headphones. I want my refund in full. I've never felt so disrespected.
